top_comments_top.body: Hey devs, can you please just turn on the machine learning ranking algorithm? Thanks

Nope because people would figure out exactly what they need to do to rank up and completely ignore everything else because winning doesn’t matter. 

Children will be toxic no matter what

I think toxicity in competitive gaming occurs regardless of players' consciousness of winrate and their rank. We tend to think of it as a phenonmenon isolated to online games, especially MOBAs, but I remember back in high school, the same thing would occur in sports games between kids in P.E. (I, for one, got flamed by my classmates a lot for being terrible at catching and throwing despite being an athletic runner. 😁) But also, flaming of teammates happens frequently in unranked games among players who never rank as well.

I agree 100% (well, I guess not) aside from the fact that I don't think you should lose rank if you win. Maybe you don't rank up quite as much (or at all), but I don't think you should be reprimanded for winning. Even if you didn't contribute much, you still accomplished the goal. 

Everything else you said I've been saying for a long time. Every game should have a ranking system that is based off your performance, not just time played or games won (like CoD and Apex). It should factor in your kills (or k/d) and your damage, game objectives, accuracy, and wins (or win percentage), plus an assortment of other game dependent things, like maybe placement in BR's or maybe even the amount of movement in something like a TDM (although I'm not 100% sure I'd agree with that last one, for various reasons).
i think apex does this pretty well except you get most points by just surviving the longest and therefore you can just camp and hide the whole match
